questions.question: She wears ……………………… make-up for my taste.
questions.description: Too much shows undesirable extremes. It is used before an uncountable noun.

questions.question: We got ……………………….. answers to our advertisement.
questions.description: We use too many before a plural noun.

questions.question: I arrived ………………………. early.
questions.description: Before adverbs, we use too, not too much.

questions.question: He is ………………………. generous.
questions.description: Before an adjective without a noun, we use too.

questions.question: It is too …………………………. to go out.
questions.description: We can use too before adjective + a/an + noun.

questions.question: The water is …………………………. salty for us to drink.
questions.description: We cannot use too much before an adjective without a noun.

questions.question: ………………………….. children love animals.
questions.description: When most means the majority of, it is used without the.

questions.question: She didn’t eat ………………………….. breakfast.
questions.description: We use much before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: You can’t see ………………………… a city in a day.
questions.description: We use much of before a determiner.

questions.question: ……………………….. the people here seem to know each other.
questions.description: We use most of before a noun with a determiner.

questions.question: ……………………………… Indians can understand Hindi.
questions.description: We use most before a noun without a determiner.

questions.question: How ………………………….. you are there?
questions.description: We use many of before a pronoun.
